text: {{Infobox settlement |name = Bluff |native_name = Motupōhue (Māori) |settlement_type = Town |image_skyline =Bluff_from_Stewart_Island_ferry.jpg |imagesize = 320px |image_caption = Bluff from Stewart Island ferry |population_total = |population_as_of = |population_footnotes = |population_density_km2 = auto |area_footnotes = |area_total_km2 = 10.10 | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = New Zealand | subdivision_type1 = Region | subdivision_name1 = Southland | subdivision_type2 = District | subdivision_name2 = Invercargill | leader_title = Regional council | leader_name = Southland Regional Council | leader_title1 = Territorial Authority | leader_name1 = Invercargill City Council | leader_title2 = Community board | leader_name2 = Bluff Community Board | image_map = | pushpin_map = | pushpin_map_caption = | coordinates = |postal_code_type = Postcode(s) |postal_code = 9814 |area_code = 03 |timezone = NZST |utc_offset = +12 |timezone_DST = NZDT |utc_offset_DST = +13 }} Bluff (), previously known as Campbelltown and is the southern town in the South Island. It has a seaside port and is on the southern coast of the South Island. It is 30 kilometers south of Invercargill. It has two primary schools in the town. ==References== Category:Towns in Southland Region Category:Invercargill
title: Bluff, New Zealand
